name: Palak Paneer
history: Palak Paneer is a popular North Indian dish made from spinach and paneer (Indian cottage cheese). It is a staple in many Indian households and restaurants.
description: Palak Paneer is a creamy and flavorful dish made with pureed spinach and soft paneer cubes, seasoned with a blend of spices. It's a nutritious and comforting vegetarian meal.

instructions.title: Prepare the Spinach
instructions.description: Blanch the spinach in boiling water for 2-3 minutes, then immerse in cold water. Drain and puree the spinach in a blender.

instructions.title: Cook the Masala
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds, and once they splutter, add onions and ginger-garlic paste. Fry until onions are golden. Add tomato puree, green chilies, turmeric, and cook until oil separates.

instructions.title: Add Spinach and Paneer
instructions.description: Add the spinach puree to the pan. Cook for a few minutes. Add paneer cubes, garam masala, and salt. Cook for another 5 minutes.

instructions.title: Finish with Cream
instructions.description: Stir in the cream and simmer for a minute.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Palak Paneer hot with naan, roti, or rice.

tips: Do not overcook the spinach, as it will lose its vibrant green color.
Paneer can be fried before adding to the spinach for a different texture.
variations: Add some fried mushrooms or corn for a variation in texture and flavor.
Replace cream with yogurt for a healthier version.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat gently on the stove or in a microwave.
presentationTips: Garnish with a swirl of cream and fresh coriander leaves.
Serve in a traditional clay pot for an authentic presentation.
